1: Any and all targeted complaints / toxicity towards another driver or the community/league is not acceptable in public chat channels. If 2 drivers are in heated debate/argument, they MUST go to post-race-smackdown or DMs and away from league chat.
2: If someone is aggressive towards or attacking any user, or anyone asks them politely to stop addressing them or to stop discussing a topic with them after the race and continues to do so, they will be subject to disciplinary action by the URA. Anyone who sees something that is considered harassment or unsportsmanlike in public channels, may file a report to Penalty Stewards.

1: Failure to use approved communication / codes, and talking in any capacity during the race or after the flag while others are still racing
2: Any violation of Pitting Code (G.2.2) or failure to return to track safely or staying in the entry/exit lane of the pits until safe to do otherwise. Failure to get into the exit side of the track safely ahead of the pit entry lane. Cutting across lanes with traffic, into faster traffic, and not allowing faster vehicles to pass, on any other unsafe motions involved in entering/exiting the track.
3: Slowly closing off someone's lane, tackling or steering into/around them on straight so that it takes away their claimed racing line or removes them from the track. This includes abrupt and erratic lane changes and movements, brake checks, or defending causing contact, and impeding.
4: Failing to leave room on a turning lane, including vehicles who are not side by side but do have a clear lane to themselves, resulting in the edging off their racing line, causing dangerous contact or removal of a driver from the course. This includes abrupt and erratic lane changes and movements, brake checks, or defending causing contact, and impeding.
5: Entering a corner with late breaking, or no braking, in which the driver makes contact with, or aggressively attacks another driver putting them at risk of ruining their line of racing through turn, instead of taking a known or safe racing line through a turn. A divebomb pass can be done safely, but is wholly at the driver's responsibility to keep it safe. A late-Break is considered an accidental form of divebomb, but is still the responsibility of the driver.
6:
Any general actions not listed above that are considered to be severe or intentional in nature - and can result in immediate penalty regardless of DP. This Includes but is  not not limited to:
- Backwards Driving other than to safely right your vehicle to the racing line without endangering other drivers (no extended distance in the backwards direction)
- Intentionally bumping/crashing/cutting off a driver
- Retiring vehicle in unsafe space
- Leaving track boundaries to gain advantage or put at risk another driver, circumventing the integrity of the track design itself or to overtake, or, to put at risk another driver to cause an incident/infraction.
7: Severe PING, Teleporting, and repeatedly creating physical incidents to other drivers due to the lack of known position on screen that is inconsistent or severe enough to be unable to predict or prevent within reasonable action of self or others. (This exempts regular high ping drivers who do not teleport, and who's position difference is consistent and predictable)
8:
- Continued targeting of a driver in-race
- Swearing in chat, aggression towards a driver or organiser
- Deliberate disrespect or ignoring of a URA official
- Deliberately leaving the track boundaries, like the outfield or grass sections, therefore taking the car out of the competition.
9: Any form of previous infraction performed to a degree that it makes a mockery of the league, drivers, organisers or game to an egregious extent. Will result in instant and immediate action by the URA

2.1: The rules in §G.1 apply when it comes to pitting procedures.
Entering the pit road safely is each driver's responsibility.
2.2: Drivers should be wary of their and other drivers' pit boxes in custom tracks such that they do not impede or block someone trying to enter or exit the pitlane or pit box.
2.3: Drivers should use the pitlane until they get to their pit box. If they cannot safely rejoin the pitlane they should drive close to the wall on the side of the pit boxes in order to avoid any accidental blocking of people attempting to pit.
2.4: Drivers should refrain from driving directly through the middle of other teams' pit boxes.
2.5: Drivers should apply common sense in default tracks where the pit box is shared and should not deliberately block another driver from pitting.

2.3: Violations described in §G.2.2 may be punished as a minor violation.

3.1: Drivers should avoid continued chatting as it can be distracting for other drivers and should keep it to an absolute minimum.
3.2:
Approved short messages
	"S" Indicate to a driver you just want to slipstream
	"B" Blue flag warning, if applicable
	"L" or "LL" Lag or lots of lag, to let SLOs know of issues
	"DNF" Followed by the reason for retirement
3: Excessive chatting which is considered a violation may be warned and punished as a minor violation. If it is considered a particularly bad violation it will be punished as a major violation.

4.1: Drivers may retire themselves from the race at any time if they can't continue the race, but should do so in a safe way.
4.2: Drivers should not leave the lobby if possible, as it may cause lag issues and in the worst case a crash. Tabbing out of the game is not advised either.
4.3: Drivers should announce their DNF and a short reason why, as well as place their car in a safe place which does not affect the remaining racers.
4.4: Drivers should not return to the lobby if they were disconnected unless it is clear that the race is no longer underway. If a new lobby is created it will be properly announced in the appropriate channel.

5.1: The driver's lag is that of an individual nature that no other racers are reporting in chat and they are freezing/teleporting/lagging repeatedly in a way that is causing them to unexpectedly and inconsistently collide with other cars.
5.2: A real life event will cause the driver to have to quit the race and not be able to return for the remainder of the race.
5.3: The driver has a controller or mechanical issue that still allows them to steer the car to safety.

4.6: Drivers should never leave the car in the middle of the road if they can avoid it nor return to normal racing after announcing their DNF. If they do so they may be punished as a major violation and will be disqualified from that event.

5.1: A driver who is DQ'd for a manoeuvre at a point during the race may have additional penalisations if deemed appropriate.
5.2: The SLOs will be in charge of deciding on additional penalties beyond the DQ itself

S.0: Applimazing is the owner of this server.
S.1: No hateful speech.  This includes insulting, flaming, and personal attacks. Toxic speech or behavior will get you permanently banned. This includes racism of any kind.
S.2: Be respectful.  Treat others the way you want to be treated and avoid religion, politics or other controversial topics. That's not what this Discord is for.
S.3: No NSFW (Not safe/suitable for work) allowed, like gore, gambling, sexual, explicit, or disturbing content.
S.4: Keep it clean. No excessive swearing- We would like this chat to be positive and fairly family friendly.
S.5: No spamming, begging, advertising, selling or promotion.  This includes private messages to our members.
S.7: No Recruiting for other Discord servers, forums or clans.
